webLinks.linkText: North Sydney Streets CBD After Dark event

properties.publicTransport: Metro services and buses run regularly to Victoria Cross at the festival site. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the North Sydney Streets CBD After Dark event from 4am to 9pm on Friday.

Local roads in North Sydney CBD will close from 11am Friday to 1am Saturday including:

  • Denison St between Berry St and Mount St
  • Spring St between Denison St and Little Spring St
  • Mount Street will be partially closed from Denison St to Walker St.

Street parking will be also be restricted within the event footprint.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Lunar Streets Festival on Saturday 14 February. Event starts at 5pm and finishes at 10pm.

  • Sections of Campbell St, Factory St*, George St*, Harbour St*, Hay St, Kimber Ln*, Little Hay St, Little Pier St*, Sussex St*, Thomas Ln, Thomas St and Ultimo Rd will be closed between 8am Saturday 14 to 1am Sunday 15 February.
  • Sections of Harbour St*, Hay St and Sussex St will also be closed from from 6am to 12pm on Friday 13 and Monday 16 February.
  • *Note: Managed access will be in place for residents and businesses during the specified times.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am Saturday 14 February on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St, and from 10am Saturday 14 February on sections of Campbell St, Thomas Ln, Thomas St and Ultimo Rd. All clearways will be lifted by 1am Sunday 15 February.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Sussex Street, Hay Street, Harbour Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Mardi Gras Fair Day at Victoria Park in Camperdown from 10am to 9pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy on roads approaching Victoria Park including on Parramatta Rd, City Rd, Cleveland St and Glebe Point Rd as attendees travel to and from the event throughout the day.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 9.30pm at the following locations:

  • City Rd between Carillon Ave and Parramatta Rd (western side)
  • City Rd between Cleveland St and Butlin Ave (eastern side)
  • Parramatta Rd between City Rd and University Ave (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ed Sheeran concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 13, Saturday 14 and Sunday 15 February. Gates open from 4pm, entertainment starts at 5.15pm (approx) each night.

Also taking place in the precinct are The AEW All Elite Wrestling Show at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 14 February, starting at 7.30pm to 10.00pm (approx) and the Sydney Kings vs Perth Wildcats at Qudos Bank Arena on Sunday 15 February, starting 4.15pm to 6.30pm (approx).

  • With around 70,000 Ed Sheeran fans expected each night along with thousands of All Elite Wrestling attendees on Saturday and basketball fans on Sunday, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.
  • Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.
  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Adelaide 36ers at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the match.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Perth Glory at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
OneRepublic at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts at 7.35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to Olympic Park in the already busy weeknight peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Dreamstate music festival at Sydney Showgrounds from 2pm to 11pm.

With thousands of people expected, attendees are encouraged to plan their trip and consider all the available travel options ahead of time.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the events. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers Double Header at CommBank Stadium

  • A-League Women's match against Adelaide United starts at 4.50pm,
  • A-League Men's match against Melbourne City FC starts at 7.35pm,
  • Finishes at 9.30pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

NRL Pre-Season Challenge game at Jubilee Stadium:

  • Match 1 - Bulldogs v Cowboys at 5.30pm
  • Match 2 - Dragons v Knights at 7.30pm
  • Finishes at 9.30pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium may close ahead of match start including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street, Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Millennium Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Festival tickets include travel on transport. Some buses will use different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Laneway Music Festival at Centennial Park from 11.30am to 10pm approx.

With more than 45,000 fans expected traffic will be heavier than usual in the area. Motorists should expect delays on Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Oxford St, Syd Einfeld Drive, Darley Rd, York Rd and Alison Rd.

Road closures and changed access arrangements will be in effect to allow crowds to safely leave the park after the event.

From 8pm there will be no direct access to the Entertainment Quarter from Anzac Parade or Oxford St due to closures of Lang Rd. Vehicle access will be permitted via Moore Park Rd eastbound only (under traffic management) and Cook Rd - follow signs and directions of traffic controllers

From 8pm to midnight 

  • Driver Ave between Lang Rd and MacArthur Ave (southern turning circle) (northbound)  
  • Lang Rd between Errol Flynn Blvd and Anzac Pde (westbound) – no right turn exit from Errol Flynn Blvd. 
  • Lang Rd* between Mitchell St and Moore Park Rd (both directions) * Managed access for residents maintained 
  • Moore Park Rd between Oxford St and Cook Rd (westbound) – no access to the EQ precinct via Moore Park Rd westbound; access via Moore Park eastbound then Cook and Lang roads only.  

From 9pm to midnight 

  • Driver Ave between MacArthur Ave (southern turning circle) and Lang Road (southbound) 
  • Lang Rd between Anzac Pde to Errol Flynn Blvd (eastbound) – no access to the EQ precinct via Anzac Pde; access via Cook Rd and Lang Rd from Moore Park Rd only.  
  • Moore Park Rd* between Oatley Rd and Oxford St (eastbound) * Managed access for residents maintained 

Gate closures and parking restrictions will also be in place within Centennial Parklands - see the Centennial Parklands website for more information.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 6am to 11.30pm on sections of Cleveland St, from 11am to 11.30pm on sections of Fitzroy St, Lang Rd and Oxford St, and from 12:01am to 11.59pm on Driver Ave.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW interactive road closure and clearway map - Mardi Gras 2026

properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops between 4pm and 2am while roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm until 4am for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7.30pm to 10:30pm. Pedestrian crossing of Oxford St and Flinders St will be available until 6:30pm only.

Major roads will be closed between4 pm and 2am. Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes. Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north. 

Key road closure timings Sat 28 Feb to Sun 1 Mar:

  • From 4pm to 1am: sections of College St, Liverpool St, Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St and surrounding local streets.
  • From 4pm to 2am: Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4pm to 4am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St, Short St and surrounding local streets in Surry Hills.
  • From 5.30pm to 1am: Anzac Pde northbound from Cleveland St to Moore Park Rd, and local roads in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Campbell St including Nithsdale St, Foster St, and Wentworth Ave.
  • From 5.30pm to 2am: Major closures along parade route including Liverpool St, Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, Flinders St southbound from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and Anzac Pde southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open).
  • From 6.30pm to 1am: Moore Park Rd westbound from Oatley Rd to South Dowling St, no access to Eastern Distributor and Driver Ave between Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd (until 10am Sunday).

Single lanes will also be closed on sections of Oxford St, Flinders St, Wentworth Ave, College St and Elizabeth St during the day and in the evening on Saturday. As well, sections of Hill St, Clare St, and surrounding local streets will close from 7am Saturday until 2am Monday.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in place between 6am Saturday 28 February and 2am Sunday 1 March on roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park including sections Oxford St, Flinders St, College St, Wentworth Ave, Park St and Liverpool St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

From 7am Saturday to 2am Sunday

  • Liverpool St between College St and Elizabeth St        
  • Oxford St between College St and Flinders St

From 4pm Saturday to 1am Sunday

From 4pm Saturday to 4am Sunday

  • Campbell St between Crown St and Bourke St
arrangementElements.title: Road, Lane and Cycleway closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Flinders Street and Anzac Parade

webLinks.linkText: What's on at the TikTok Entertainment Centre

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming events at TikTok Entertainment Centre (ICC Sydney Theatre):

  • Matt Rife 'Stay Golden World Tour' - Friday 30 and Saturday 31 January
  • The Music of John Williams: Episode II - Saturday 7 February
  • An Evening with Dream Theater 40th Anniversary Tour - Saturday 14 February
  • GIVĒON - Wednesday 18 February
  • A Special Evening with Christian Horner - Thursday 26 February
  • Josh Groban - Saturday 28 February

﻿Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the shows, particularly during peak evening periods.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne Victory at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 3.30pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Upcoming festivals at Bondi Beach

  • Crowded House, Friday 20 February, 5pm to 10pm
  • Mighty Hoopla, Saturday 21 February, 2pm to 10pm

With large crowds expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Bondi Beach. Motorists should allow extra travel time and expect delays on Campbell Pde, Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event.

Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions: 

  • Queen Elizabeth Drive: south of Bondi Pavilion closed from 4pm Thu 19 Feb until 6am Sun 22 Feb. Enter and exit Queen Elizabeth Drive (north) from the northern end during this time.
  • Park Drive South Carpark: Closed from 8pm Mon 16 Feb to 6am Tue 24 Feb
  • Parking zone restrictions will be in place to support the above closures. Any vehicles parked in these areas during this period will be towed. 

Road closures: Campbell Parade will close southbound from Curlewis Street from 9:30pm until 10:30pm on Fri 20 Feb and Sat 21 Feb, with detours in place.

properties.publicTransport: Route buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lakemba Nights during Ramadan will be held on Haldon Street in Lakemba every Thursday to Sunday, 6pm-2am from 19 February to 15 March.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly during the busy weeknight peaks on Thursdays and Fridays during the event.

Road closures Thursday to Sunday, 4pm to 4.30am, from Thursday 19 February to Sunday 15 March

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and Gillies St
  • Haldon St between 168 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Quigg St (The Boulevarde will open at 4am) 
  • Gilles St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies Lane between Gillies St and Quigg St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St and Haldon St 
  • Oneata Lane between The Boulevarde and Oneata St. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time, and follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Motorists will be detoured around the road closures on Thu-Sun via the following routes: 

  • Southbound traffic in Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde/Moreton St/The Boulevarde/Quigg St/Grace Ave/Haldon St to Canterbury Rd. 
  • Northbound traffic in Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave/Quigg St/The Boulevarde/Moreton St to Lakemba St. 
  • Eastbound traffic in The Boulevarde west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd. 
  • Westbound traffic in The Boulevarde east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St/Grace Ave/Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in effect for a State Funeral.

The following roads will close from 8am to 1pm

  • King St between Elizabeth St and Phillip St (South)
  • Phillip St (South) between Hunter St and King St 
  • King St cycleway will be closed between Phillip St (South) and Queen’s Square from 9.30am to 1pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 6am to 1pm on the southern side of King St between Elizabeth St and Phillip St (South), and both sides of Phillip St (South) between Hunter St and King St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

One Republic will be in concert at Speers Park. Traffic signals will be in place at the pedestrian crossing to assist with queuing.

Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists. Motorists travelling north will be diverted via Main Road.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT Lookout One Republic Concert

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Love Lanes Festival will be held in the Town Centre.

Local road closures may be in place, with diversions.

Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.
